S.FORM: aip tu cinpitu, kusian a saikin pasnanavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: na'isnavaanin, kusianin a masnanava sian pasnanavaan, at tushit a lavian tu, “minduldula! pissauk!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: tushit a kaimin tu, “mihumisang masnanava.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: masa isnavaanin hai, isnavaan a kaimin mas malisBunun tu issisipul.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the ethnic language of numbers.

S.FORM: tususulut a kaimin mas masnanavacia masipul, at kahuzas a kaimin mas huzassipul.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: uhansiapan a saikin mas supah ituBunun tu halinga.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many ethnic languages.

S.FORM: kaupahanian a saikin kusian mas pasnanavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學。
I go to school every day,

S.FORM: kaupahanian a saikin mapasnava mas malisBunun.
S.TRANSL: 我天天學族語。
I learn the ethnic language every day

S.FORM: napata'azaunku a inaak cina.
S.TRANSL: 我要講給媽媽聽。
and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: inaak ngaan hai Alang.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Alang。
My name is Alang.

S.FORM: inaak tu tama ngaan hai Biung.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Biung。
My dad’s name is Biung.

S.FORM: inaak tu cina ngaan hai Savi.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Savi。
My mother’s name is Savi.

S.FORM: punmas'an tu haminsan a saikin.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: aizaan a saikin mas tasa tu tuhasnanaz, tupaun a saia tu Tahai, aip hai pun11 tu hamisan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Tahai，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Tahai, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: muskun kaimin isian tasa tu pasnanavaan isnavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: mazima saikin siin inaak tu tuhasnanaz kahuzas.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: mazima saikin sunghaul, mais islunghu hai, muskun a kaimin tastulumah kudiip sunghaul.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: mazima saikin mapasahaal mas bahlu tu kaviaz, mahtu kaimin muskun kahuzas siin sunghaul.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: saikin hai ituBunun tu uvaaz.
S.TRANSL: 我是布農族的小孩。
I am an Bunun child.

S.FORM: taikisian kaimin Nansalu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在南沙魯。
Our family lives in Nansalu.

S.FORM: kat'a'ima a kaimin.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: aizaan inaak tastulumah tu tatau uvaaz.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: muskun a saikin mas tama cina siin tuhasnanaz tuhaspingaz minhumis.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: malauskav a inaak tama, saia hai kisacu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: matukulaaz a inaak cina, saia hai ising.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: palisBununun a kaimin mas inaak tu tama mais ilumah.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.

S.FORM: ku'asang a kaimin mais lunghulabal.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: taskun a saikin mas masituhas madamu takula.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: madaidaz a saikin mas inaak tu tastulumah.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: taskun a saikin aip mas inaak tu cina kudiip mapahainan.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: masanglav a dihanin mais hanian, nitu maklang, nitu mabahis, makazavkazav a iv'iv.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: isian a kaimin masu'ismuut maun mas paang, mais sanvaliun hai masmuav tu mananghat.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: masa hanianin, cindanghas a dihanin.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: masingav saikin mas cina tu: mavia tu sambaiv a dihaninan i?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅彩色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: antalam a cina tu, “adu nabalivusanin.”
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: uka a luum masa sanavan, at sandimaldimal a bintuhan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: nakulumahin a kaimin.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: masa isian daan, masi'aupa saikin mas bintuhan masumsum.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: mahtuang a balivusa nitu minsuma, aupa na'asa'ang saikin muhna kudiip mapahainan.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: mansisila a inaak pasnanavaan mas inaak tu lumah, kaupahanian a saikin kanbantas kusian pasnanavaan, at kanbantas amin kulumah.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校和回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: nii a inaam pasnanavaan madaing, kakauman a pantu, paha mapasahaal amin kaimin.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: mazima amin a pantu muskun isian daisah, pismali siin mahalinga.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: minsaan amin a masnanava mais muskun mas zamin pishasibang, maszang a pasnanavaan mas tastulumah.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: kaupahanian a kaimin ma'asik, mapisaningsing mas pasnanavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: aiza bunun mahaishais mas siul, aiza ma'asik mas buav.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: ma'asikang kaimin mas iskakaupa tu sikvin, maciskun amin kuzakuza, paha kaupahanian a inaam pasnanavaan masaningsing.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: kusian a saikin asang, masa takna tantungu sian inaak tu tamahudas.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: malbuntuin a kaimin nitu mapasadu, paha mililiskin a saikin mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: masa usaduan a tamahudas mas zaku hai, mapakaunku mas suika, mapahuudku mas ucia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: madavus a itutamahudas sinsuaza suika, tuza tu masial kaunun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: mazima'ik amin mas itutamahudas tu ucia, masial amin huudan.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: masa taunghuvali'in, muskunik mas cinahudas ma'anat mas pinittaunghuvali.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: ma'anat a cinahudas mas vaivivaivi tu kakaunun, aiza mai'iskaan, aiza maitulkuk, aiza baat, aiza'ang maimumuan
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: masa minaunin mas pinittaunghuvali hai, kusian kaimin pissanglavan kasanglav.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: siza a cinahudas mas supah tu utan, tai, cilkung, isaiv mas zaku tu na'ispa'adas kulumah.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: nasampalavaazin a kaimin at mapatupa tu, namuhnang tantungu maisinin.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: aip, adasunim mas masnanava kusian patcician, cindailaz a kaimin sian ilav tu namabaliv mas kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: masa taunangadahin sian patcician hai, tupa a masnanava tu: maltanangausan hai hahazam, maltan'ikua hai i'ivut, kananaka amin sadusadu.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: aupa mapisingik mas ivut, paha nii a saikin sadu mas i'ivut.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: usaduanik mas supah tu hazam, isian a naia mas lukiscia kusbabai, usaduanangik mas ithuu tu isian haitungavlukis masabah.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: aiza a sisipzuh, luba siin uknav isian patciciancia, nii'ang saikin sinadu mas naitaan tu cici manaskal i mahtu hanian usaduan.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: macisupah a saikin mas haningu tu na'ispasaduku mas tamacina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: mais maisinin hai, nataskunik mas tamacina kusaincin.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: aip tu islunghuan, taskunik mas tuhaspingaz kusian Taitu tantungu sian pantamaun.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: maisnasianim Taihuku tunkasulin kusian Taitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: masa taunasian Taitu, uting a pantamaun mas lailai anpasdu mas zami.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: aupa mal'aisku a patlailaian mas itupantamaun tu lumah, paha ma'aipi mais tunlailai taunadiip.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: aiza a madaing tatangkaunan mal'aisku mas itupantamaun tu lumah, taskun kaimin tuntampu kusian tatangkaunancia.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: isian tatangkaunancia, adasun kaimin mas pantamaun mapakaun mas sidi siin tunluba.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: masa sanavanin, taskunim kusian hici maun mas pinitsanavan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: supahdaingaz a lailai isian hici, paha uting a kaimin mas utubai kudiip.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: masa namacisludin hai, ishaiapan tu tanghaiun a utubai, paha kazinim tunbasu.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: musuhisin a kaimin kusian Taihuku, nitu haiap tu adu'ingkaduanin a itupantamaun utubai.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: taikisianik sian Nansalu masa uvaazang haitu isnavaanin sian kuminkaku hai tausian Taihuku, katsianin hici minghumis.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在南沙魯，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Nansalu . After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: isnavaanin sian daikaku, mapasnava'ik mas pali'Incumin tu ispaspasnava, uhaiapan mas ituTai'uan Incumin vaivivaivi tu sinpalihumis.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: paha, aip tu lunghulabal hai, taskunik mas tuhasnanaz kusian mai'asang masingav mas madadaingaz, cis'uni tu na'asa uhaiapan mas itu'anak'anak tu sinpalihumis.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: pun80in tu hamisan a madaingaza, haitu maszangang mas tailutbu mais saduan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: masingavangik saicia tu mamaaz a halinga hansiapunsu? madauzung a isaicia malisBunun, mahansiap amin malisTa'ialu, malisNGaingai siin malisLipun.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的布農族語說得很流利，也會說泰雅語、客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: tudiipinik haiap tu maipasnava hangsia a saia mas malisLipun masa uvaazang, musasu Ta'ialu a isaicia pingaz musasu cis'uni kuzakuza at mapasahaal mas supah tu NGaingai, paha haiap supah tu halinga.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: masa masingav a kaimin hai, tahu a madaingaza mas supah palihanup tu taiklas.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: haalim nitu maplaz tu ithaal, haitu maku'uni kaimin mas takutaa macihaningu, namahtu aipcinin itmantukun.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: masa uvaazangik hai, nitu haiap mas itu'anak'anak tu sinpalihumis, paha maz'avmaz'av mais tupa tu Incumin saikin
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: mais supahin haiapun hai, makanadidiip usaduan tu min'uni mas Bunun hai makitvaivi, mahtu iskuniv.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: nakulumah a naubananaz mais mansanavanin.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: taskunik mas cinahudas kusian babalivan mabaliv mas tulkuk, na'anatun mais sanavanin i na'ispakaun mas naubananaz.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: anhaibim sian tatansunsanglav, supah a babahlu sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mabalivim mas takunkun, utanbauna siin tauplasdanghas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: malala a mandainglan tatansun mas kanakaununa tu, “madavus a inaak bunglai siin halupan. mahtu mabaliv tu kauman ha!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: mabalivim mas bunglai siin halup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: anhaibim sian tatansun mas maicici, tupa a laupaan tu: namaaz balivunsu? masmuhdaingaz a aip tulkuk, kaaz tasa ka 300 tu sui.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: sa'aklis a cinahudas at masingav tu adumahtu iasui'unang tu kauman.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: haitu antalam a laupaan tu: iasuidaingazin hai, nii'in tu mahtu pisvanahun.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: malala a mansisila laupaan tu, “mabaliva inaak tu iskaan, madaing at iasui a inaak iskaan.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: kinuzin, mabalivim mas tulkuk siin iskaan, kulumah ma'anat mas tastupangkaka tu pandian.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: malbuntuin mastatala, dungzavin isdumdum.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: patunding'ua a naubananaz tu: tusha a kuaping tu nitu mahtu islunghu, nasinlunghuin tu niciu mahtu kulumah.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: tupa a cinahudas tu, “supah a sin'anatan at tan'alia mas bunun tu minsumaa kuskun.”
S.TRANSL: 因為奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: tan'ali'im mas tas'aan siin tunali, kuskun mas vaivivaivi tu pinitsanavan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: aizaanik tasa aluszangan tupaun tu Dahu, mazima lalaktan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Dahu，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Dahu, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: mais isnavaan hai, simul sian aluszangan mas ispapatas, ishahaishais siin ahil.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: mus'an, mupus'an, muciun, mapasimulang amin aluszangan mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: haitu, dangian a saia mas makuang tu kainaaman, mais sinimul hai nitu masuhis.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: kinuzin, nii'in amin asa mapasimul mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: aiza tu hanian, kudiipim mapahainan.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: isianang daan, cin'asa a Dahua muunata, haitu nitu minadas mas ahilkuskus.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Dahu想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Dahu wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: nasimul a saia sian aluszangan mas ahilkuskus, haitu tupa amin tu: nii'ik amin minadas.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: kaivakaiva a Dahua at tangis, malsupnuh tupa tu, “mavia kamu tu nitu mapasimulku mas ahilkuskus i!”
S.TRANSL: Dahu急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Dahu burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tahuan a saia mas aluszangan tu: atanau i niias kanak'anak maadas, musasu mais pasimulanas hai, nitu namasuhis.”
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: masa kutunin tu isnavaan, macinsanus a Dahua kusian pasnanavaan, sizaun mas dahucia a sinsisimul masuhis sian aluszangan.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Dahu很早就到學校了，Dahu把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Dahu arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: masi'aupa a Dahu sian aluszangan pisssuhdung, at tupa tu: nakanak'anakik maisinin maadas mas iskukusia, uninang mas aluszangan i maipasisimulku mas haimangsut.
S.TRANSL: Dahu向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Dahu apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: inaak tama hai hahanup.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: masa uvaazangik, kunata a tama siin pantamaun mais sanavan, maadas mas singhaili siin busul.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: mais istus'a'in hai, maadas a naia mas hinanup tu cici minsuma.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: minsaan mais vanis, minsaan mais aval, duanduan aiza cikulas.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: pavazun naicia a cici, is'siahtu sian taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: kaupakaupa'ik uningai mas tama tu namalavi mas tama kudiip hanup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: tupa a tama tu, na'adasunik. mais taldaingin.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: mahansiap amin a taikisian asang mabananaz maku'ahu madamu mas cici, mahansiap a naia ka'uni mas ahuduun siin hatup.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: mahansiap a inaak tama ka'uni mas ahuduun tupa a tama tu, is'a'ahu a sain mas cikulas, asa kata tu samantuk mas itucici tu kaindapanan, asa a ispalasung tu pusianun nalahaiban mas naicia.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: cis'uni tu na'asa ma'aipi taskun mas madadaingaz hanup, paha kaupahanian a saikin tatanam malka'ahu, zaav a inaak sinpal'ahu cisduan mas cici.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: masa ishaiapan a tama hai, tupaku tu, namin'unias mas talhanupan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: aip, taldainginik, cis'ama'ik mas inaak tu busulkavi siin hatnga, malavi mas tama kudiip hanup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: masa taunasianin asang hai, is'siahtu zami a hinanupan sian taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: tupa a tama tu, asata tu matumashing mas Dihanin tu sintauhumis, masaiv mita mas supah tu hinanupan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: alasan a saikin masa um'um kausian pasnanavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: masa kausian pasnanavaan hai, sipungul a saikin ma'adas mas kabaang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: maningzav tu uka a adasunku.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: masa isnavaan hai, muskun a saikin mas aluszangan sadu mas ahil.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: masa sikiing hai, pasimulanik mas aluszangan mas ispapatas siin ishahaishais.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: tupaunik mas masnanava tu “macingmuta minkailas mais muhna'in, kakaa'in alasan!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: tupaun a inaak kaviaz tu Biung, ituBunun amin a saia tu uvaaz.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Biung，他也是布農族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Biung, and he is also an Bunun child.

S.FORM: muskun a kaimin sian Nansalu isnavaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在南沙魯部落讀書。
We study together in the Nansalu tribe.

S.FORM: mabuntu a kaimin muskun ta'aza mas madadaingaz palihabasan, mahansiap amin a kaimin malisBunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農族語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.

S.FORM: malauskav a saikin aat masmuh, mapucis a Biung aat matukulaaz.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Biung很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Biung is short and thin.

S.FORM: mahatba a Biung, mazima amin bunun mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: Biung很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Biung is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: aip hai itupasnanavaan tu pantataip, supah a ispasavai sian pasnanavaan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: aiza a mapasibutbut, pismalibantas, cisdadaan, pisvakavaka, pisbusulkavi.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: min'amu a saikin mas cisdadaan.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: ciskapat a saikin masa cisdadaan, pishaidang a, malung.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: haitu, minsalangka a saikin, macingna'ang cisdadaan.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: masa taunasian pas'upaan a saikin hai manaskal amin a bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: haal nii a saikin atalu mas taismitasa, haitu, manaskal a saikin, aupa saukanahtung a saikin mapasavai.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: taskunik masa takna mas tama, tantungu sian pantamaun.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: milu'lu a itupantamaun bantas.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: tahuanim mas saicia tu mubulah a itulumah tatavi.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: masa kahna a saia mas tatavi hai maisnatatavi muhalhal.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: ma'adas a tama mas maitulkuk siin bunbun isaiv mas pantamaun.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了雞肉和香蕉給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: muskunik mas pantamaun mahalinga sian asabahan, tahu a saia mas supah tu habasan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: masa namacisludim hai atumaslingunik mas pantamaun tu tallauskavin, mintalmainduu'in amin.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: tupa'ik tu mais mindaduin a itupantamaun bantas hai tantungua amin sian zamian.
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: mais isian 2022 painsanan hai namas'ampuk a Sihu mas pali'uni Incumin tu nibunsiu tu nakatasaan a ngaanBunun mapatas
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: maisingavik mas mabuntu pakasia sihu, nasiza mas nakatasa ngaanBunun mapatas sian nibunsiu tu minduduaz Haisul Palavian.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Haisul.Palavian。
I interviewed Haisul.Palavian, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: mapatuzikaangin a saikin mas saicia tu nakausian isaicia tu lumah masingav mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: masa masisingav hai papasahaalunik tu maikusna'isa a isaicia ngaan. papasahaalku amin mas isaicia tu tastulumah. isaicia tu asang.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: tupaunku a saia tu: mavia a kasu tu na'asa matsuhis nganbubun i? masial aupa a tatuuna ispatutuki hai?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要回復族名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: tupaunik mas saicia tu aupa nii a patasantauluu'an mahtu mathas tu mapishaiap mas isaicia tu ngaan. aiza a bunun malala mas saicia tu Hai tais'aan, aat min'uni mas iskangingiit.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Hai Xian Sheng

S.FORM: tupa a Haisul.Palavian tu: maza maku'uni mas malis'Imcumin mapatas tu ngaan hai imita mamantuk tu ngaan. daihiu a inaak ngaanan mas imita tu siduh, imita tu sinpathaal. hadang madia a tais'aan masuhais mas itu'anak'anak tu ngaan.
S.TRANSL: Haisul.Palavi說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

Noami Kulas said, “The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group, our family, our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.”

S.FORM: taskunik masa takna mas hudaspingaz kaudiip matansun, ma'adas a hudaspingaz mas supah kai'anak'anakan masuaz tu sanglav, ka'uni'ang amin mas kakaununBunun isaiv mas tais'aan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: mazima amin a tais'aan mas ituhudaspingaz tatansunancia, madia a bunun mabaliv mas mahav siin cilkung, madia a bunun minsuma maun mas sin'anat saicia tu pandian.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和蕗蕎很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: masial kaunun a isaicia inanat tu li'li siin pinit'ia tu haising, aiza'ang ku'unian haimis mapitsimal tu maivanis, si'upa mas madia tu dudulap, malsauluk amin sian inaam tatansunantan.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的海慕斯滷肉，吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: mais ma'a'anat a hudaspingaz hai isisila a saikin tutushit luklas mas dudulap tu, “maza sanglavan hai kai'anak'anakan tu sinsuaz, mail'anak, miskava mabaliv.”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: ma'aipi a inaam istatansun ispaku'amin, tupa a hudaspingaz tu, “cis'uni aupa aiza a kasu maindangaz.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: pakasian mas andiip iskuzakuzatan, upasnavaanik mas ituIncumin lisavaz siin kakaunun tu hansiap, musasu u'intau'unian mas matansun tu kai'ihdian.
S.TRANSL: 透過這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: sadu mas hudaspingaz tu mazimadaingaz mas malantangus tu kakaunun, masvinik tu makuniv siin sibauszang.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
